clinical_study.brief_title: Optimal Duration of Antimicrobial Susceptibility Test (AST) Guided Rescue Therapy for Helicobacter Pylori Infection

brief_summary.textblock: Strongly evidence supports that H. pylori eradication is an effective approach to reduce the incidence of those pathologies. However, due to the increasing resistance rates to antibiotics, failures of H. pylori eradication get more and more common. Thus, rescue therapy for persistent H. pylori infection is becoming a grand challenge the investigators have to face.

primary_outcome.measure: The different rate of H. pylori eradication among 3 different course of treatments (7-day, 10-day and 14-day) guided by AST in intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis.
The different rate of H. pylori eradication among 3 different course of treatments (7-day, 10-day and 14-day) guided by AST in per-protocol (PP) analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: the rate of improving dyspepsia symptoms after H. pylori eradication
the rate of adverse events happening

intervention.description: Patients in this group will receive a 7-day triple regimen to eradicate H. pylori. The regimen is consist of a PPI and 2 susceptible antibiotics which are determined by AST. The susceptibility of amoxicillin, clarithromycin, metronidazole, tinidazole,levofloxacin, furazolidone and tetracycline will be evaluated.
